items.title: Will a controversial water plan lead to 'bad years' for Roper River barramundi?
items.summary: Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws have revealed planned water extraction from the aquifer that feeds the Northern Territory's Roper River could lead to "bad years" for its fish populations.

items.title: Victorian government defers increases to controversial emergency services levy in budget update
items.summary: The Victorian government has backed down on key parts of an unpopular tax used to fund the state's emergency services as part of its budget update.

items.title: Oscar Piastri's journey from humble beginnings to the brink of the Formula One championship
items.summary: After finishing last in his first race, Oscar Piastri has risen from humble beginnings to the brink of Australian sporting history as he chases his first F1 world title.

items.title: What time is the F1 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix and how to watch Oscar Piastri in championship race
items.summary: The Formula 1 world drivers' championship has gone down to the wire, with three drivers set to battle it out for glory at the season-finale Abu Dhabi Grand Prix.

items.title: Ayers Rock Resort to be sold to American-owned tourism company
items.summary: A deal for the sale of operations at Ayers Rock Resort, near Uluru, and the Mossman Gorge Cultural Centre, in Far North Queensland, is one step closer after the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation reached an agreement with Journey Beyond, an Australian-based "experiential tourism" company owned by an American private equity firm.

items.title: Family lose holiday home on Tasmania's east coast
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: SA Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia steps down from leadership
items.summary: South Australian Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia will step down from the leadership, just three months out from the next state election. He told a press conference he made the decision on Friday morning.

items.title: All five members of 90s British boy band FIVE are back on tour after 25 years
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: WA miners build up massive gold stockpiles at Perth Mint amid record prices
items.summary: WA gold miners are stockpiling millions of dollars worth of the precious metal, believing it is more valuable than cash in the current environment.

items.title: Fires, heatwaves strike across Australia with emergency warnings issued — as it happened
items.summary: A broad heatwave is expected to spread across Australia, with short and sharp bursts of heat throughout the southern states.

items.title: US military says it killed four men in strike on suspected drug vessel
items.summary: The US military says it has killed four men in a strike on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the Eastern Pacific

items.title: Socceroo Aziz Behich excited that World Cup draw could set up rematch with Argentina
items.summary: The Socceroos cannot wait to learn who their opponents will be at the upcoming World Cup, especially if it allows them to handle some unfinished business.

items.title: Australian red-tipped bananas go viral as social media interest ramps up
items.summary: Red-tipped bananas are not new to Australian consumers, but they have gone viral on social media this month after an inquisitive post from two bewildered British backpackers.

items.title: Police on scene at Gregory Hills shopping centre after shots fired at man outside gym
items.summary: Police swam on a shopping centre in south-western Sydney after a man narrowly avoided injury after being shot at.

items.title: Country Hour reporters join listeners to celebrate 80 years of broadcasting
items.summary: Outside broadcasts highlight how the Country Hour connects with the daily life of rural Australia.

items.title: Dozens of property damaged in Dolphin Sands bushfire on Tasmania's east coast
items.summary: There has been damage to at least 19 homes and shacks and 15 outbuildings at Dolphin Sands, on Tasmania's east coast, firefighters say, with residents told it is not yet safe to return.

items.title: Zak Crawley says Nathan Lyon being dropped for second Ashes Test helped him find rhythm
items.summary: Nathan Lyon speaks during an awkward TV interview as Zak Crawley says the spinner's omission helped the English batter find his rhythm.

items.title: Police officer's claim about search for Lindy Lucena in Ballina tested at watchdog hearing
items.summary: A Law Enforcement Conduct Commission is examining why it took police officers nearly an hour to respond to a Triple Zero (000) call about an assault which left Lindy Lucena dead at the hands of her partner.

items.title: Children risk life in prison for some violent crimes after Victorian parliament passes bill
items.summary: Children as young as 14 years old could spend life in prison for some violent crimes after the Victorian parliament passed a controversial bill on Thursday. So what are the changes?

items.title: Diners and commercial fishers to feel impact of WA demersal fishing ban
items.summary: New fishing rules come into effect in Western Australia next month, significantly reducing the amount of local fish available in the state.

items.title: Pentagon's AUKUS review finds areas to put nuclear submarine pact on 'strongest possible footing'
items.summary: The review has "identified opportunities to put AUKUS on the strongest possible footing", the Pentagon says. But a congressman who has seen the report says it "fully endorses" the pact.

items.title: Compressed air energy storage is coming to Broken Hill, but how does it work?
items.summary: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

items.title: Local consortium races to rescue Sanjeev Gupta's Tahmoor mine
items.summary: A local consortium is rushing to put forward a bid for the mothballed Tahmoor coal mine, saying it wants the site reopened quickly to protect hundreds of jobs.

items.title: ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launches in Australia, partners with NextDC, ASX closes slightly higher — as it happened
items.summary: The company that brought AI into household vernacular launched in Australia today. It comes as other companies like Meta are struggling to make traction in this space.

items.title: South Australian golf course wetland is breeding site for locally extinct tiny native olive perchlet
items.summary: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

items.title: Alex Carey channels AFL pedigree for classic Ashes catch despite Marnus Labuschagne's tackle
items.summary: Alex Carey's phenomenal catch late on day one at the Gabba would have been special all on its own, but it was made even more impressive after he had to "out-body" his own teammate.

items.title: Rheumatic heart disease cases drastically reduced in North West Queensland
items.summary: A lack of access to clean clothes and sheets led to high rates of heart disease in this outback Queensland town. But an Indigenous-led washing initiative is changing health outcomes in the region.

items.title: The cold supermoon will appear in the night sky tonight. Here's how to spot it
items.summary: The final supermoon of the year is set to delight stargazers tonight. Here's how to spot it.

items.title: Impacts of working from home on mental health tracked in study of 16,000 Australians
items.summary: Working from home can positively impact the mental health of Australian men and women in different ways, according to a new study of more than 16,000 people.

items.title: Living with ADHD and how I make my life easier after being diagnosed as an adult
items.summary: International Day of People with Disability scholar Mark du Potiers shares how attention deficit hyperactivity disorder impacts him day-to-day and what he does to make life more manageable.

items.title: Heatwave stretches from Kimberley to Sydney as hot summer arrives
items.summary: The burst of heat is short and sharp in southern states, sending temperatures more than 10 degrees Celsius above average and raising fire dangers to extreme, with the heat to linger into next week in the northern outback.

items.title: What is shotcrete, the material that caused Sydney's M4 tunnel closure?
items.summary: The issue with the commonly used substance caused delays where some motorists were gridlocked for more than four hours on Thursday morning.

items.title: The Ashes are kickstarted at last by Mitchell Starc and Joe Root, but Australia's underbelly is tested
items.summary: A day of tough, fluctuating Test cricket kickstarts the Ashes series at last as Mitchell Starc and Joe Root carry their sides despite concerns about what lies beneath.

items.title: Pentagon watchdog releases report on Pete Hegseth's use of Signal app
items.summary: The 84-page report finds US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policy and could have put American troops at risk when he used the Signal app to discuss military strikes in Yemen.

items.title: Australia's PALM workers are leaving their employers, becoming 'extremely vulnerable' in visa limbo
items.summary: Pacific Islanders have been leaving Australia's guest worker scheme, a decision that breaches their visa conditions and leaves them "extremely vulnerable".

items.title: Industrial relations are risky business for the Liberals after WorkChoices
items.summary: The Liberals argue Labor's industrial relations concessions to the unions are a "handbrake on productivity" but this area has been tricky for the Coalition since John Howard's disastrous overreach.

items.title: Teen becomes first nationally accredited netball umpire in a wheelchair
items.summary: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

items.title: Search engines will soon have to blur porn image results in Australia
items.summary: Pornographic image results will be blurred and searches for self-harm information will redirect to mental health supports under new Australian online safety codes.

items.title: Education leaders call on News Corp to cease 'harmful' NAPLAN league tables
items.summary: Forty-one signatories to an open letter say they are "dismayed" and that school rankings cause "harm to our communities".

items.title: Is Tasmanian AFL team a holy grail or poisoned chalice? Time will tell
items.summary: When it comes to the Macquarie Point stadium in Tasmania, there is clearly something deeper at play than seats, concrete and a roof. You simply couldn't vote for it otherwise, writes Chris Rowbottom.

items.title: Corowa residents caught off guard by 'early' fire a sign of 'apathy', authorities say
items.summary: A fast moving grass fire almost burned through the southern NSW town of Corowa last week. Despite the extreme fire danger rating, residents say they weren't prepared for such an intense fire so early in the season.

items.title: Victorian prisoners held in police stations for weeks, lawyer says
items.summary: A Victorian lawyer says a "crisis" is unfolding in the state's jails, with remand centres so crowded prisoners are instead being kept in police holding cells for up to a month.

items.title: The best new TV shows of 2025, from The Golden Bachelor to The Studio
items.summary: From a send-up of Hollywood studios to a chilling depiction of violence and masculinity to an age-appropriate reality TV romance, these are our favourite TV shows of 2025.

items.title: Today in History, December 5: How Prohibition was brought down by gangsters, bootleggers and violence
items.summary: Prohibition was officially repealed on December 5, 1933. But the beginning of its end can be traced back years earlier — to a highly-publicised massacre by firing squad.

items.title: AUKUS will survive Trump, says Australia's top diplomat in London Stephen Smith
items.summary: The trilateral agreement has come under significant scrutiny, but Australia's top diplomat in London says he believes its future is assured.

items.title: Israel to compete at Eurovision Song Contest in 2026, prompting several nations to withdraw
items.summary: Public broadcasters in Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands say they will not participate in next year's event and more are expected to follow.

items.title: New York Times sues the Pentagon over press access restrictions
items.summary: The US publication has filed a lawsuit over a new policy requiring journalists to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the Pentagon.

items.title: What does Vladimir Putin want from his state visit to India and his meeting with Narendra Modi?
items.summary: The Russian leader's first state visit to India in nearly four years is expected to focus heavily on trade amid a backdrop of international sanctions and Donald Trump's tariff policy.

items.title: Value of private health insurance 'eroding' as doctors urge reform
items.summary: A new report from Australia's peak doctors' body says private health insurance is increasingly failing to deliver value to the roughly 15 million Australians who hold a policy.

items.title: Putin bears 'moral responsibility' for 2018 poisoning of UK woman, inquiry finds
items.summary: A UK public inquiry concludes that Russian President Vladimir Putin "must have" ordered the Novichok nerve agent attack on Russian double agent Sergei Skripal in 2018.

items.title: Hobart stadium at Macquarie Point gets final approval in parliament's upper house
items.summary: A $1.13 billion stadium on the edge of the Hobart CBD has been approved by Tasmania's upper house, satisfying a key condition for the state's AFL licence.

items.title: Root notches century despite stunning run-out, non-Starc seamers struggle without Lyon — five quick hits from Ashes second Test day one
items.summary: Joe Root overcomes a horror mix-up to notch a long-awaited first Test century in Australia, while Australia's seamers largely struggle without the dropped Nathan Lyon. Here are the quick hits from the first day of the pink-ball Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: Ashes 2025: Nathan Lyon's axing leaves Australia struggling on docile Gabba pitch in second Test
items.summary: Australia leaves Nathan Lyon out of its XI for the second Ashes Test at the Gabba, marking an almost 14-year first.

items.title: Hobart’s new stadium likely go ahead
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Alleged manslaughter victim told classmate she was 'treated like a slave' at home, court hears
items.summary: A girl who was allegedly criminally neglected at the hands of her mother before she died told a friend she was "treated like a slave" and was "scared to go back home", a court has heard.

items.title: Thursday finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Rare PNG conjoined twins en route to Australia as case reaches 'critical' point
items.summary: A rare set of conjoined twins are being urgently airlifted from Papua New Guinea to Australia, with doctors recommending they be separated as soon as possible.

items.title: Calls to reinstate organ donation driver's licence scheme
items.summary: As the Victorian government moves to bring back the driver's licence donor registration scheme, DonateLife wants it to be nationwide, saying there is clear evidence it leads to an increase in organ donors.

items.title: Marles 'going through' Trump AUKUS review
items.summary: Richard Marles says the government has received the Pentagon's much-anticipated review into the $368 billion AUKUS submarine pact, reiterating Washington has been "fully supportive" of the deal.

items.title: Behind the Lines political cartooning exhibition opens in Canberra, awarding Matt Golding the top prize
items.summary: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

items.title: Tasmanian minister censured for withdrawing footy club funding after it attended opposition's media event
items.summary: Tasmanian parliamentarians have censured a minister for breaking his word to a local football club after it attended an election campaign media event with the opposition.

items.title: Condoms and contraceptives to become more expensive in China as Beijing accelerates push to lift birth rate
items.summary: China is ending a decades-long tax exemption on contraceptives to push up its birth rate. Experts say the change could leave women and young people more vulnerable.

items.title: Canberra man Michael O'Connell sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter of partner Danielle Jordan
items.summary: A Canberra man is sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter, after the ACT Court of Appeal overturned his murder conviction for the death of his partner.

items.title: Gangster Mejid Hamzy's enemies and 'torture plot' revealed as alleged gangland assassins found not guilty
items.summary: Mejid Hamzy's murder sparked Sydney's deadliest gangland war in a generation. For two years what led to his demise has been a secret.

items.title: Cost of living remains a sore point for voters as political year wraps
items.summary: A mammoth year in politics ended with a focus on what is worrying most Australians ahead of Christmas: the cost of living.
